00023 #include "midas.h"

00025 #ifndef _EPICS_CA_PRIVATE_H_
00026 #define _EPICS_CA_PRIVATE_H_

00028 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00029 
00030 #define CHN_NAME_LENGTH     32      /* length of channel names */
00031 #define CHNFLAGS_LENGTH     16      /* chan flags string size */
00032 
00033 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00034 
00035 #ifdef GFA_SPECIFIC
00036 
00037 #define DTYPE_LENGTH        40     /* epics DBR_STRING size - fixed */
00038 #define DSEC_LENGTH         40     /* epics DBR_STRING size - fixed */
00039 
00040 #endif
00041       //    DD settings
00042       //    DD/Loadfile <loadfile>
00043       //      <loadfile> will be read and interpreted and DD entries for
00044       //      EPICS Channel name, Used, Readonly, Chn_flags, Minval, Maxval, Threshold,
00045       //      Tolerance will be created if it they did not previously exist
00046       //
00047       //    DD/AlarmWhenNOTConnected <alarm>
00048       //      if not NONE, Alarm <alarm> will initially be reset in epics_ca_init() and
00049       //      when Sum_NOT_Connected changes to 0.
00050       //
00051       //    DD/Sum_NOT_Connected <number>
00052       //      <number> > 0 may be used as Alarm level
00053       //
00054       //    DD/AlarmWhenNOTinTolerance <alarm>
00055       //      if not NONE, Alarm <alarm> will initially be reset in epics_ca_init() and
00056       //      when Sum_NOT_in_Tolerance changes to 0.
00057       //     e.g.: Alarm condition for Alarm "BL tolerance" 
00058       //       /Equipment/eblpim3/Settings/Devices/EPICSGFA/DD/Sum_NOT_in_Tolerance > 0
00059       //
00060       //    DD/Sum_NOT_in_Tolerance <number>
00061       //      <number> > 0 may be used as Alarm level
00062       //      NOTE: Pending operations set Sum_NOT_in_tolerance > 0 until reliable
00063       //            checks are possible. To make sure WAIT <device> INRANGE in autorun
00064       //            waits until all operations are completed.
00065       //
00066       //    DD/EPICS Channel name []   max. 32 characters
00067       //
00068       //    DD/Used []          y/n
00069       //
00070       //    DD/Readonly []      y/n
00071       //
00072       //    DD/Chn_Flags []
00073       //  
00074       //      Chn_flags are evaluated when (re)connecting, reading or setting the 
00075       //      respective channel
00076       //
00077       //      - Initial value not changed yet after initial setup
00078       //        U = NOT USED (Channel will not be handled)
00079       //
00080       //      - Initialized
00081       //        I = Channel may be used and has no special flags
00082       //
00083       //      - channel subscription may be disabled          
00084       //        S = NO subscription of channel changes
00085       //            e.g. for strings
00086       //
00087       //      - update demand value of channel when readout of value changes
00088       //        F = Feedback of demand channel readout to demand value of 
00089       //            channel when demand value was not updated by epics_ca_set()
00090       //            in the last 60 seconds
00091       //        NOTE: ODB update only - demand value will not be put to EPICS channel
00092       //
00093       //        See GFA specific flag G for update of Command or Setpoint channel demand
00094       //        by the interpreted readout of a measured or status channel.
00095       //               
00096       //      - Min/Max Info for GUI or Min/Max value when sending new demand value 
00097       //        to EPICS channel
00098       //        M = Write Min & Max in DD during first init of DD/MinVal and DD/MaxVal
00099       //            Change new demand value to Min or Max value when out of range
00100       //
00101       //        NOTE: Maybe modify Min/Max of channels manually when channel is not 
00102       //              available during init or Min or Max value should be different 
00103       //        NOTE: any value may be set if MinVal and MaxVal are both equal to 0
00104       //        NOTE: any value may be set if M is not specified in DD/Chn_Flags
00105       //
00106       //        Delete DD/MinVAl DD/MaxVal after the first setup to regenerate
00107       //        Min/Max from LOW/HIGH when channels are connected.
00108       //        NOTE: S and U overrule M
00109       //                                                       
00110       //      - information when channel is not connected ....               
00111       //        D = Set measured value to -1 to flag channel not found, disconnected
00112       //            or no read access
00113       //
00114       //      - information if channel is not connected
00115       //        C = check if channel is not connected. 
00116       //        NOTE: When NOT connected DD/Sum_NOT_connected is incremented. 
00117       //
00118       //      - reset demand value
00119       //        R = (Re)set Demand value on EPICS channel when channel is reconnected
00120       //            and readout of demand value and demand value differ.
00121       //        NOTE: Setpoint must always be valid. 
00122       //              e.g. GFA device type FENTE must therefore always be set to
00123       //                   setpoint and command MOVE_TO_SOL must be set
00124       //
00125       //*** GFA Specific *** 
00126       //
00127       //      - update demand value of channel corresponding to measured or status chan
00128       //        G = Feedback from "Measured" or "Status" channel readout to correspondng
00129       //            demand channel and demand value was not updated by epics_ca_set()
00130       //            in the last 60 seconds. 
00131       //        NOTE: ODB update only - demand value will not be put to EPICS channel
00132       //        NOTE: Type FENTE :SOL:2 will only be updated with IST1:2 or POSA:2
00133       //              when not moving anymore (NOT 0x0100 and NOT 0x0200) and in status 
00134       //              "stopped" (0x0004) and previous cmd was SOL=POSA(0x0004) 
00135       //              or cmd was MOVE_TO_CW/CCW (0x0000/0x0001) and status is 
00136       //              "in CW/CCW limit switch" (0x0001/0x0002)
00137       //        See non GFA specific flag F for update of demand by demand readout
00138       //
00139       //      - additional epics channel e.g. for Power ON/OFF may be set
00140       //        according to GFA device type
00141       //                
00142       //        P = Turn power ON  (other channel e.g. :COM:2) when setting this channel
00143       //                                                       e.g. :SOL:2
00144       //        N = Turn power ON  (other channel e.g. :COM:2) when setting > 0
00145       //            Turn power OFF (other channel e.g. :COM:2) when setting <= 0
00146       //        Z = Turn power OFF (other channel e.g. :COM:2) when setting to zero
00147       //            Turn power ON  (other channel e.g. :COM:2) when setting <> zero
00148       //        NOTE: N overrules Z and P. Z overrules P.
00149       //
00150       //      - set command set_to_demand on other channel    
00151       //        V = Set value for "Move to setpoint" MOVE_TO_SOL=0x0003 
00152       //            (in other channel e.g. :COM:2 for GFA type FENTE)  
00153       //            when setting this channel e.g. :SOL:2
00154       //
00155       //      - check tolerance of this channel
00156       //        T = check if (this) demand channel e.g. <dev>:SOL:2 and corresponding
00157       //            measured channel e.g.: <dev>:IST:2 are in tolerance 
00158       //            when <tolerance> of demand is > 0.
00159       //            Do not check tolerance when demand value is negative and N flag is 
00160       //            set. 
00161       //        NOTE: When NOT in tolerance DD/Sum_NOT_in_Tolerance is incremented.
00162       //
00163       //      Examples of channel flags
00164       //
00165       //      EPICS Channel   GFA_type    Channel flags  Iscmd
00166       //      -------------   ----------  -------------  ------
00167       //      FS11-L:COM:2    FENTE        I             y
00168       //      FS11-L:STA:1    FENTE        IG            y
00169       //      FS11-L:SOL:2    FENTE        IVMCTRF       y
00170       //      FS11-L:IST1:2   FENTE        IG            y
00171       //      ASM11:COM:2     BEND         I             y
00172       //      ASM11:STA:1     BEND         IG            n
00173       //      ASM11:SOL:2     BEND         IFZMCTR       y
00174       //      ASM11:IST:2     BEND         I             n
00175       //      KSD11:COM:2     BX           I             y
00176       //      KSD11:STA:1     BX           IG            n
00177       //      SEP31HVN:SOLI:2 HVPS         IF            y
00178       //      SEP31HVN:SOLV:2 HVPS         IFT           y
00179       //
00180       //*** END GFA Specific *** 
00181       //
00182       //    DD/Minval []  [0.0]
00183       //       Minimum value from Loadfile or updated from LOW attribute of Channel
00184       //       when M flag is set and DD/Minval does not exist
00185       //
00186       //    DD/Maxval []  [0.0]
00187       //       Maximum value from Loadfile or updated from HIGH attribute of Channel
00188       //       when M flag is set and DD/Maxval does not exist
00189       //    NOTE: if Minval[i] and Maxval[i] of EPICS channel [i] is 0.0 there will be
00190       //          no range checking when a demand value is set on channel [i]
00191       // 
00192       //    DD/Tolerance [] [0.0]
00193       //       Tolerance from Loadfile 
00194       //    NOTE: Tolerance will not be checked when 0.0 is set as tolerance
00195       //
00196 
00197 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00198 
00199 typedef struct {
00200    char   loadfile[NAME_LENGTH]; // file name of load file
00201    char   AlarmWhenNOTConnected[NAME_LENGTH];
00202    int    Sum_NOT_Connected;     // sum of DOWN channels with C flag set
00203    char   AlarmWhenNOTinTolerance[NAME_LENGTH];
00204    int    Sum_NOT_in_Tolerance;  // out of tolerance channels with T flag & tol > 0.0
00205    char  *channel_names;       // channel_names
00206 #ifdef GFA_SPECIFIC
00207    char  *dtype;               // description type    (also for interpretation by GUI)
00208    char  *dsec;                // description section (also for interpretation by GUI)
00209 #endif
00210    char  *chnflags;            // special flags of channel
00211    float *minval;              // channel minval
00212    float *maxval;              // channel maxval
00213    float *tolerance;           // channel tolerance
00214    BOOL  *used;                // used flag
00215    BOOL  *readonly;            // readonly flag
00216 } CA_SETTINGS;
00217 
00218 typedef struct {
00219    CA_SETTINGS settings;       // DD specific settings in ODB
00220    chid  *pchid;               // channel ID of channels
00221    float *array;               // channel readout
00222    float *array_m;             // channel readout mirror
00223    float *demand;              // channel demand
00224    float *threshold;           // channel threshold (only used when reading loadfile)
00225    DWORD *lastset;             // channel timestamp when last set
00226    DWORD *lastget;             // channel timestamp when last get
00227    int   *status;              // status returned in event handler
00228    BOOL  *found;               // found flag
00229    BOOL  *iscmd;               // iscmd flag
00230    BOOL  *subscribed;          // subscribed flag
00231    BOOL  *down;                // down flag
00232    BOOL  *firstread;           // flag expecting first reading when UP again
00233    INT   *nerr;                // number of errors
00234    INT   *nmsg;                // number of messages
00235    INT   *tolchan;             // index of corresponding tolerance channel
00236    INT   *gchan;               // index of corresponding channel with G-flag
00237    BOOL  *intol;               // channel is/is not in tolerance range
00238    INT    num_channels;        // number of channels
00239    DWORD  flags;               // flags supplied when epics_ca(CMD_INIT, ...) is called
00240    INT    cmd_disabled;        // command execution in epics_ca() is initially disabled
00241    INT    subscribe_disabled;  // subscribe (in connection handler) is initially disabled
00242 #ifdef GFA_SPECIFIC
00243    BOOL   handling_disabled;   // GFA specific handling is (currently) disabled
00244 #endif                         // to avoid infinit loop of handling dependencies...
00245    char   name[NAME_LENGTH];   // equipment <name>
00246    HNDLE  hkeyDemand;          // "/Equipment/<equi>/Variables/Demand" key handle
00247    HNDLE  hkeyDD;              // "DD" key handle
00248    HNDLE  hkeySNC;             // "DD/Sum_NOT_Connected" key handle
00249    HNDLE  hkeySNT;             // "DD/Sum_NOT_in_Tolerance" key handle
00250    DWORD  lastSNC;             // last time Sum_NOT_Connected of C flag channels
00251    DWORD  lastSNT;             // last time Sum_NOT_in_Tolerance of T flag channels
00252    INT    pending;             // pending operation -> increment Sum_NOT_in_Tolerance
00253 } CA_INFO;
